result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 05-02-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas S. Beaupre
Current: 819 S. 20th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 03-29-2022)
Prior: 815 S 26th St A, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Felony bail jumping as repeater, on 03-14-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of misdemeanor bail jumping and 3 cts. felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-04-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Meijer.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
